<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18903>

            Bug ID: 18903
           Summary: Extend read.dcf to ignore commented-out lines
                    (R-dev-day 2025 issue 86)
           Product: R
           Version: R 4.5.x
          Hardware: All
                OS: All
            Status: NEW
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: I/O
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:edd@debian.org|edd@debian.org>

Created attachment 3491
  --> <https://bugs.r-project.org/attachment.cgi?id=3491&action=edit>
Patch for Issue 86 of R Dev Day in May 2025

During the [R Dev Day held after Rencontres R
2025](<https://github.com/r-devel/r-dev-day/discussions/88>) at Université de
Mons (BE) organised by Heather Turner and Philippe Grosjean, a group comprised
of Hugo Gruson, Laurent Gatto and myself worked on [issue
86](<https://github.com/r-devel/r-dev-day/issues/86>) entitled "Improve DCF
reading and writing" which had been proposed by Kurt Hornik.  Following initial
discussion to clarify the scope, it was determined to not work on `write.dcf`
which is fine as is given that UTF-8 encoding is now more or less universal. 
This left the R- and C-based implementations of the read path which we did. 

Most of the discussion is in the referenced GitHub issue, it also shows a patch
(where I appear to have skipped a few lines at the beginning).  A clean patch
against the then-current SVN repo is attached.  An alternate source is [at this
URL](<https://github.com/r-devel/r-svn/commit/8beea2ba6ef234c617118386b698d09419c9dc47.patch>)
which is the commit behind [PR 203](<https://github.com/r-devel/r-svn/pull/203>)
to the GitHub mirror of this SVN repository.

The 'shadow PR' at GitHub tested cleanly for fourteen setups in his continunous
integration matrix covering various R versions and operating systems.

Lastly, it is with some embarassment that I just now rediscover that I actually
filed a subset of the very same issue already in 2021 as bug 18043 with almost
the same C implementation making it a little grueling to think about how long
it took to re-work the TRE logic in the C side of the patch.  Ah well.

So if this is merged, it should close 18043 as well.

This patch was made against the GH mirror of the R svn.

I don't know if it's policy to typo correct old NEWS entries.

```
$ sed -n '13718,13720p' doc/NEWS.2
    o   add1.[g]lm now try harder to use the environment of the
        formula in the orginal fit to look for objects such as the
        'data' and 'subset' arguments.
$ 
```

This GNU `sed` line could be run to implement a fix.

```
$ sed -i "s/orginal/original/g" doc/NEWS.2
$ 
```

*[Bug 18907] New: Cryptic 'R CMD check' parse error*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18907>

            Bug ID: 18907
           Summary: Cryptic 'R CMD check' parse error
           Product: R
           Version: R 4.5.x
          Hardware: Other
                OS: All
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Misc
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:hpages.on.github@gmail.com|hpages.on.github@gmail.com>

Hi,

The examples in an Rd file can contain an issue that will cause 'R CMD check'
to report the following warning and error:

    * checking Rd contents ... OK
    * checking for unstated dependencies in examples ... ERROR
    Warning: parse error in file 'lines':
    37:12)
    ** will not attempt to run examples
    * checking examples ... SKIPPED

The problem here is that the warning message is completely uninformative so
it's not clear how the developer of the package is supposed to figure out
what/where the problem is.

FWIW I've made a small package that triggers such 'R CMD check' warning and
error here: <https://github.com/hpages/crypticcheckerr>

Would be nice if 'R CMD check' could emit a more useful warning/error message.
